intro: Tanacetum kotzebuense, commonly known as the Kotzebue goldenroot, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America and Eurasia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Tanacetum kotzebuense is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
